business.headline: Does EPFO's new ECR system simplify return filing for employers?The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has launched a revamped electronic challan-cum-return (ECR) system, aiming to make return filing easier and more accurate for employers. But does it really simplify the process?

Will RBI announce a rate cut in the upcoming MPC meeting? Here's what to expectThe Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee begins its three-day meeting to decide whether it is time to cut interest rates or hold steady. With inflation easing and growth signals mixed, all eyes are on what the central bank does next.
Experts reveal best festive stocks to buy amid global uncertaintyConcerns over global trade talks with the US and new protectionist measures have weighed on investor sentiment
Sensex opens 142 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; BEL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 114.15 points to 80,540.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 36.45 points to 24,691.15 as of 9:24 am.

Arattai success proves why Zoho won't rush going public, says Sridhar VembuIn a post on X, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu said that some of Zoho's key projects, such as its messaging app Arattai, would have never been built under the financial pressures faced by public companies.

LIC sees Rs 1,100 crore inflows on Day 1 of GST-free life cover: ReportLife Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) collected over Rs 1,100 crore in inflows on the first day following the removal of GST on individual life insurance policies.
Insured, but where is the protection?Despite the recent reform of zero GST, insurance remains an opaque industry where customers struggle to understand what they're actually buying.

Buying home this festive season? Top things to check before Griha PraveshaFamilies often see this period as the most auspicious time to make a big investment like a home, but experts warn that it is also the stage when due diligence becomes most important.

Nirav Modi's brother-in-law Maiank Mehta pardoned in Rs 13,000 crore PNB scam caseA special CBI court granted pardon to Maiank Mehta, brother-in-law of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi, in the Rs 13,000 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case.

What to expect from the National Stock Exchange in the next 5 years?Ashish Chauhan, CEO of NSE Chauhan, said the rise in investors and market size over the last decade gives a clear idea of the potential ahead. In 2014, India had just 1.67 crore unique investors. Today, there are about 12 crore investors.

50% tariffs and growth: Why India must focus on reform, not retaliationAt the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts called for reforms, investment-led growth, and targeted support for vulnerable sectors to navigate challenges from steep US tariffs.

Explained: Why Dalal Street has an edge over global stock marketsAt the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, Ashish Chauhan, CEO of the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE), explained why India's markets and economy hold a stronger position for the future compared to others.

entertainment.headline: All Spider-Man films to re-release in India this November Sony Pictures will re-release all major Spider-Man films in cinemas across India throughout November and early December, giving fans and new audiences the chance to experience every era of the superhero on the big screen.

Varun Dhawan handles complaint about driver's rash driving calmly in viral video A video of Varun Dhawan calmly handling a complaint about his driver's rash driving has gone viral, earning him widespread praise for his patience.

Actor Mahesh Manjrekar's 1st wife Deepa Mehta dies, son Satya shares tribute Actor-filmmaker Mahesh Manjrekar's first wife and renowned costume designer Deepa Mehta has died, as confirmed by their son Satya Manjrekar on social media. The Marathi film fraternity has expressed heartfelt condolences, remembering her contributions to cinema and her entrepreneurial success.

Aishwarya Rai in Paris with Aaradhya ahead of fashion week. Videos viral Actor Aishwarya Rai was in Paris with her daughter Aaradhya ahead of Paris Fashion Week. In the videos surfacing on social media, the actor can also be seen interacting with her fans.

BB19 episode 36: Harsh Gujral, Abhishek Malhan's roast leaves Tanya Mittal in tears Salman Khan hosted the 'Bigg Boss 19' Weekend Ka Vaar episode with the 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' team, featuring dance performances and interactions with the housemates. The episode included the eviction of Awez Darbar, emotional moments for Tanya Mittal, and humorous feedback from guests Abhishek Malhan and Harsh Gujral.

Big B teases Shoaib Akhtar's Abhishek goof up after India's Asia Cup win Amitabh Bachchan congratulated Team India after they defeated 'dushamn' Pakistan in the Asia Cup final match. In his post, the actor even jibed at Shoaib Akhtar's recent gaffe.

Diljit Dosanjh pauses Hong Kong concert to pray for singer Rajvir Jawanda Diljit Dosanjh paused his Hong Kong concert to urge fans to pray for fellow singer Rajvir Jawanda, who is fighting for life after a serious bike accident. Rajvir is currently hospitalised following a tragic bike accident.

Rishab Shetty faces flak for delivering Kannada speech at Kantara Telugu event Actor Rishab Shetty spoke in Kannada at the Telugu pre-release event for 'Kantara: Chapter 1' in Hyderabad. Several Telugu fans expressed dissatisfaction on social media about his choice of language.

Bigg Boss 19: Abhishek Bajaj's ex-wife Akanksha accuses him of infidelity 'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Abhishek Bajaj's ex-wife, Akanksha Jindal, claimed that he cheated on her during their marriage. She said infidelity and dominating behaviour led to their divorce. The confession came after their wedding photos re-surfaced earlier this month.

Bobby Deol to burn Raavan effigy at Red Fort on Dussehra Actor Bobby Deol will participate in the traditional Raavan Dahan ceremony at Delhi's Red Fort on October 2, as part of the Luv Kush Ramlila celebrations.

Samantha Ruth Prabhu opens up on love, self-acceptance amid relationship rumours Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared a heartfelt Instagram note on embracing authenticity in her thirties, contrasting it with the restless pace of her twenties. She also talked about love amid relationship rumours.

Rapper Bad Bunny to headline 2026 Super Bowl halftime show Puerto Rican artist Bad Bunny will lead the 2026 Apple Music Super Bowl LX Halftime Show, marking his second performance at the event and highlighting his global influence and cultural impact.

India lifts Asia Cup: Amitabh Bachchan to Mammootty, celebs congratulate team India defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the Asia Cup 2025 final. Amitabh Bachchan, Mammootty, Anil Kapoor, Preity Zinta and several other celebrities publicly celebrated the win by posting congratulatory messages.

Priyanka Chopra's new photo dump features Nick, Malti, Ishaan Khatter, Dia Mirza Priyanka Chopra shared her New York photo dump featuring Nick Jonas, daughter Malti, and industry friends, calling it "a little fall moment with the people you love." She spent quality time with Ishaan Khatter and Dia Mirza.

Jr NTR says Kantara Chapter 1 would be humanly impossible without Rishab Shetty Jr NTR praised Rishab Shetty's extraordinary vision and hard work during the Telugu pre-release event of 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. Despite his recent injury, he expressed deep admiration for the film's scale and cultural significance.

43 kisses to best papa Ranbir: Raha's birthday gift and Alia Bhatt's Insta wish Ranbir Kapoor celebrated his 43rd birthday with a special promise from his daughter Raha. Alia Bhatt shared a few glimpses of his birthday from their short holiday.

Angad Bedi spends best evening with Sachin Tendulkar, Virender Sehwag and friends Angad Bedi enjoyed one of the most memorable evenings in the best company of cricketing legends, Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag. Neha Dhupia, his actor-wife, left a hilarious comment on his Instagram post.

Awez Darbar gets evicted from Bigg Boss 19 Digital influencer Awez Darbar has been evicted from 'Bigg Boss 19'. He, along with Pranit More, Ashnoor Kaur, Gaurav Khanna, Neelam Giri and Mridul Tiwari, were nominated for eviction this week.

8-year-old TV actor Veer Sharma, brother die in apartment fire in Rajasthan's Kota A sudden fire broke out in a flat in Kota's Transport Nagar area on Sunday, claiming the lives of two children -- eight-year-old television actor Veer Sharma and his 16-year-old brother, Shoriya Sharma.

general news.headline: Amid Vijay stampede blame game, letter shows TVK sought temporary power cutAmid a growing controversy over the Karur rally stampede, a letter from Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam reveals the party requested a temporary power shutdown citing public safety.

Arattai app explodes 100x in 3 days as sign-ups soar from 3,000 to 350,000 dailyArattai, from Zoho is seeing a massive boost in popularity. The app has recorded a jump in daily sign-ups from 3,000 to 350,000 in just three days. Some users are also calling it a potential WhatsApp killer.

Her 'Mann Ki Baat': PM Modi writes foreword to Giorgia Meloni's memoirPM Modi praised Meloni as a "patriot and outstanding contemporary leader" whose journey, he said, mirrors Indian values and would resonate with readers.

New script to spread propaganda: AAP, BJP spar over Asia Cup trophy dramaIndia's five-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup final in Dubai on Sunday night has received widespread praise from the nation's top political leadership, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who called the win "Operation Sindoor on the games field".

Asia Cup: India win. Pakistan do a Pakistan. Cricket suffersAsia Cup 2025 promised tension, yet the final sank to an unprecedented low when India, the victors, were denied the trophy. Celebrations continued in an empty stadium, but the episode showed how egos and off-field drama can overshadow the game. If this becomes the template for India-Pakistan clashes, cricket itself will bear the cost.

Deeply concerned: X to appeal High Court order on complying with takedown noticesX announced it would appeal against a Karnataka High Court order enforcing compliance with takedown notices, warning it enables arbitrary directives by millions of police officers and threatens free expression.

Garba's changing beat: How the dance has changed, from Ahmedabad to MumbaiOnce a spiritual, community-centred dance in Gujarat, garba has now been commercialised. Its folk forms are dying in Gujarat itself, but the dance is uniting people across age groups, from Delhi to Bengaluru. The dhol beats and dandiya clicks might have been replaced by techno, but its new avatar still has the same old energy.

Photo op or pep talk? Trump's surprise entry at top generals' meet sparks buzzLast week, Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth summoned hundreds of generals and admirals, including senior commanders of the one-star rank or higher and their top advisers, to the Marine Corps base in Quantico, Virginia, with little notice.

NRI couple apologises for kissing at Vadodara Garba event after viral video outrageSoon after the video of the NRI couple surfaced, calls for strict action against them as well as the organisers of the Garba event in Vadodara began circulating online.

Arattai success proves why Zoho won't rush going public, says Sridhar VembuIn a post on X, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu said that some of Zoho's key projects, such as its messaging app Arattai, would have never been built under the financial pressures faced by public companies.

How Kolkata's Durga Puja stage has a new political actor in Abhishek BanerjeeFor Abhishek, who keeps a low profile during Puja season, the decision signals both the countdown to Bengal polls and his gradual assumption of command of the TMC

Karur stampede: High Court to hear Vijay's TVK's plea on Friday amid blame gameTVK has filed a plea before the Madras High Court's Madurai Bench seeking a CBI or SIT probe into the tragedy, while a victim has moved the court to restrain the party from holding further rallies.

Why society still doesn't understand postpartumFeeling alone during the postpartum period is common for new mothers. Yet, while they navigate life-altering physical and emotional changes, society often expects them to 'be normal,' overlooking the challenges they face.

Aspirin and heart attacks: The evidence, the risks, and the right way to use itIn India, where emergency medical access could sometimes be delayed by traffic snarls, hospital distances, or lack of immediate recognition, the question arises: can something as simple as chewing an aspirin buy a patient precious time?

PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi ran away with Asia Cup trophy, says BCCI secretaryBCCI secretary Devajit Saikia took a sharp dig at PCB head Mohsin Naqvi after the Asia Cup final on Sunday. He said that Naqvi went away to his hotel room with the Asia Cup trophy after India won the title by beating Pakistan.

Gaza peace deal in final stages: Trump ahead of meeting with NetanyahuDonald Trump has also suggested that the Gaza agreement "will be the first chance for real peace in the Middle East", adding that if it comes to fruition, it would be "a great day for Israel and the Middle East".

No trophy, no problem: Surya leads Asia Cup celebration with photoshopped picsIndia stars added a trophy emoticon to their celebration pics to mock Mohsin Naqvi after the PCB chief ran away with the Asia Cup title on Sunday, September 28. The Indian players said they won't accept the trophy from Naqvi at the post-match presentation.

Why fresher hiring in Indian IT is muted despite bigger talent pool from H1B curbsThe broad outlook is that headwinds and macroeconomic uncertainties will continue to hit the intake of freshers by the IT sector
Insured, but where is the protection?Despite the recent reform of zero GST, insurance remains an opaque industry where customers struggle to understand what they're actually buying.

Nasa races to deflect 1.4-ton observatory falling back to EarthSwift, launched in 2004 and parked in low-Earth orbit at around 585 km above the planet, is gradually losing altitude due to atmospheric drag.

Rishab Shetty faces flak for delivering Kannada speech at Kantara Telugu eventActor Rishab Shetty spoke in Kannada at the Telugu pre-release event for 'Kantara: Chapter 1' in Hyderabad. Several Telugu fans expressed dissatisfaction on social media about his choice of language.

Videos capture moments of panic, tragedy of Karur stampedeHarrowing videos from the Karur rally captured the horror of the deadly stampede, showing grieving parents with lifeless children, frantic cries, and shock-stricken crowds as dozens, including women and children, lost their lives.

Live: Deaths during Vijay's Karur rally rise to 41Vijay rally stampede updates: At least 40 people died, and many others were injured after a stampede broke out during a political rally of TVK chief Vijay in Tamil Nadu's Karur on Saturday evening. The victims included women and children, while those who fainted during the commotion were taken to the nearest hospital for treatment. The Tamil Nadu government announced Rs 10 lakh each for the families of the victims, and also constituted an enquiry commission to probe the incident. Stay tuned for the latest updates.

'Everyone's mother dies': UCO Bank official accused of toxic conduct in viral emailThe email, addressed to UCO Bank's top management, was titled "Complaint Regarding Inhuman and Toxic Behavior by Zonal Head, Chennai – Request for Immediate Action."

sports.headline: Chamari Athapaththu goes for one last push in Sri Lanka's title hunt Sri Lanka return to the Women's World Cup after an eight-year absence, led by the legendary Chamari Athapaththu and a promising crop of youngsters, blending experience and youthful energy.

Asia Cup was all about India vs India: Harbhajan Singh plays down Pakistan rivalry Harbhajan Singh has claimed that the Asia Cup was always about how well India would perform in the tournament and said that the rivalry with Pakistan was well and truly over. India defeated Pakistan to win the Asia Cup 2025 final.

From bearded Vikings to smooth warriors: India complete cricket Ashwamedh India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph showcases a new generation carrying forward the legacy of bearded giants. Tilak Varma, Shivam Dube, and Abhishek Sharma emerge as game-changers, blending fire, skill, and calculated aggression.

Abhishek Sharma subtly jabs 'premium' pacer Shaheen Afridi after Asia Cup triumph Abhishek Sharma subtly took a dig at Pakistan's "premium" pacer Shaheen Afridi after India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph, reaffirming his aggressive intent from the powerplay while leading India to their ninth title.

Watch: Arshdeep, Harshit, Jitesh mimic Abrar Ahmed's celebration after win After India's Asia Cup final win over Pakistan, Arshdeep Singh, Harshit Rana, and Jitesh Sharma playfully mimicked Abrar Ahmed's head-tilt celebration. India won the title after winning by five wickets.

You're getting angry: Surya shuts down salty Pakistan reporter with witty remark Suryakumar Yadav shut down a Pakistan reporter who questioned the Indian team's behaviour towards Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2025. India defeated Pakistan to win the title on Sunday, September 28.

Cricket was played in Asia Cup final. Tilak's day in the sun is proof of it Asia Cup final, India vs Pakistan: Long before the trophy fiasco unfolded at the Dubai stadium, Tilak Varma had crafted a masterclass knock against Pakistan in the high-pressure final, ensuring that cricket remained the true protagonist of the day.

Clairvoyants Tilak and Rinku willed on Sept 6 exactly what they would do in final India players Tilak Varma and Rinku Singh made their manifestations come true with a breathtaking display in the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan. Tilak anchored the innings with a brilliant 69 off 53 balls, while Rinku, getting to play for the first time in the tournament, was there to hit the winning runs on Sunday.

Ex-Pakistan captain calls for India's suspension after ugly day in final Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif slammed India for refusing to accept the Asia Cup 2025 trophy from ACC Chairman Mohsin Naqvi, calling it an "ugly day for cricket" and urging the ICC to consider suspension.

Asian champions India best team in the T20 format: Sunil Gavaskar Sunil Gavaskar claimed that India are the best team in the world when it comes to the T20 format after their thrilling win against Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 final on Sunday, September 28.

Haris Rauf a run-machine vs India, entire Pakistan criticises him: Wasim Akram Haris Rauf was slammed by Wasim Akram after leaking crucial runs in the Asia Cup final against India. Despite Pakistan's hopes, Rauf's refusal to play red-ball cricket and repeated run-conceding spells drew national criticism.

Cricket was played in Asia Cup final. Tilak's day in the sun is proof of it Asia Cup final, India vs Pakistan: Long before the trophy fiasco unfolded at the Dubai stadium, Tilak Varma had crafted a masterclass knock against Pakistan in the high-pressure final, ensuring that cricket remained the true protagonist of the day.

Clairvoyants Tilak and Rinku willed on Sept 6 exactly what they would do in final India players Tilak Varma and Rinku Singh made their manifestations come true with a breathtaking display in the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan. Tilak anchored the innings with a brilliant 69 off 53 balls, while Rinku, getting to play for the first time in the tournament, was there to hit the winning runs on Sunday.

Ex-Pakistan captain calls for India's suspension after ugly day in final Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif slammed India for refusing to accept the Asia Cup 2025 trophy from ACC Chairman Mohsin Naqvi, calling it an "ugly day for cricket" and urging the ICC to consider suspension.

Asian champions India best team in the T20 format: Sunil Gavaskar Sunil Gavaskar claimed that India are the best team in the world when it comes to the T20 format after their thrilling win against Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 final on Sunday, September 28.

Haris Rauf a run-machine vs India, entire Pakistan criticises him: Wasim Akram Haris Rauf was slammed by Wasim Akram after leaking crucial runs in the Asia Cup final against India. Despite Pakistan's hopes, Rauf's refusal to play red-ball cricket and repeated run-conceding spells drew national criticism.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
